subject: Creativity
title: Shakespeare's Fools: The Wisest Characters on Stage
description: A short lesson to help you apply Shakespeare's Fools: The Wisest Characters on Stage.

hook.text: In 'King Lear,' the Fool is the only character who tells the king the truth. Everyone else is too afraid.

buildup.text: Shakespeare's fools use humor as a shield â€” their jokes contain the sharpest truths in the play, delivered safely.

discovery.text: Court jesters had a real social function: they were the only people who could criticize the king without being executed.

twist.text: The tradition continues: late-night hosts, satirists, and cartoonists say what journalists can't.

climax.text: Studies show people trust comedians more than politicians or journalists for honest commentary.

punchline.text: The jester's job hasn't changed: tell the truth and make it funny so nobody.

quiz.question: Why could court jesters criticize kings when no one else could?
options: Humor served as a form of diplomatic immunity
They were too unimportant to punish
